name: dispersively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves or causes dispersion (= the spreading of something across a large area): What would you expect to see if the DNA had replicated dispersively? Pesticides are often emitted dispersively, for example when spraying them into the air.
physics
  specialized in a way that involves or causes dispersion of light (= its separation into different colours): This paper quantifies the residual errors of dispersively registered images for two types of sensor. The lightning bolt excites a wave that propagates dispersively along the Earth's magnetic field.
More examplesFewer examplesThis chapter discusses the characteristics of dispersively reinforced concrete.The powder is dispersively supplied to the upper section of the chamber.
